creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
marks: Poem by Kaseitei Shironari 花盛亭白成 [観雪斎月麿寫] {Kansetsusai Tsukimaro sha}
medium: Woodblock print (surimono); ink and color on paper with nikawa and silver
text: Kintarō is a hero from Japanese folklore, a child of super-human strength who grew up among the animals on Mount Ashigara. Eventually he became a loyal follower of the samurai Minamoto Yorimitsu (948-1021). On Boys’ Day in Japan, a Kintarō doll is displayed so that boys will become equally brave and strong. Here Kintarō wrestles an oversized raptor that shows elements of an eagle, hawk, and falcon.
title: Kintarō Subduing a Raptor with a Large Axe
